name: The A to Z of Soccer Multiple Choice Quiz | Soccer | 25 Questions

questions.text: This A is an English club that once played its home games at Highbury.
questions.explanation:
Arsenal.

	The Gunners.

questions.text: This B is a Portugese club that plays at the original Stadium of Light.
questions.explanation:
Benfica.

	One of the mightiest teams in Europe once, this huge club had fallen on hard times in the early 2000s.

questions.text: This C is an English team that plays at Stamford Bridge.
questions.explanation:
Chelsea.

	Some commentators say the Blues are the most glamorous club in England.

questions.text: This D is an English team which moved from the Baseball Ground to Pride Park.
questions.explanation:
Derby County.

	The Rams.

questions.text: This E is an English team whose nickname is the Toffees.
questions.explanation:
Everton.

	Everton play at Goodison Park.

questions.text: This F is an English team that plays at Craven Cottage.
questions.explanation:
Fulham.

	Promoted to the FA Premier League at the end of season 2000-01, this West London club will forever live in the shadow of its more glamorous neighbour.

questions.text: This G is a Turkish club which is famed for its notoriously colorful supporters.
questions.explanation:
Galatasaray.

	Galatasaray are up there with the best in Europe.

questions.text: This H is a German club that can really make 'mince meat' out of their opponents.
questions.explanation:
Hamburg.

	Hamburg ... Hamburger ... oh well, never mind.

questions.text: This I is an English club which is based in Suffolk.
questions.explanation:
Ipswich Town.

	Once winners of the UEFA Cup, Ipswich are only just coming back to the big time.

questions.text: This J is an Italian club that could be mistaken for the 'Magpies'.
questions.explanation:
Juventus.

	Juventus are one of the world's biggest soccer clubs.

questions.text: This K is a German team that is one of the best in their league.
questions.explanation:
Kaiserslautern.

	Kaiserslautern were riding high in the German championship race most years.

questions.text: This L is an English Club that has a great tradition of successes in Europe.
questions.explanation:
Liverpool.

	Liverpool have one of the best records in European competition. They play at Anfield.

questions.text: This M is an English club that has the biggest world-wide fan base.
questions.explanation:
Manchester United.

	What else can be said?

questions.text: This N is an English club whose nickname is the 'Magpies'.
questions.explanation:
Newcastle United.

	Newcastle play at St James' Park. Their nickname, is because of their black and white strip.

questions.text: This O is a Greek club which is always there, or thereabouts.
questions.explanation:
Olympiakos.

	Panathanaikos are their main rivals.

questions.text: This P is a Portugese club that plays in broad stripes of blue and white.
questions.explanation:
Porto.

	Porto have been the strongest force in Portugese soccer in the late 1990s and early 2000s. They play at the Antas Stadium.

questions.text: This Q is an English club that plays in blue and white hoops.
questions.explanation:
Queens Park Rangers.

	QPR play in West London.

questions.text: This R is a Scottish club which is one of the two 'Big' clubs in Scotland.
questions.explanation:
Rangers.

	Rangers, a Glasgow team, are one of the most famous clubs in Britain.

questions.text: This S is an English club which moved from Roker Park to the Stadium of Light.
questions.explanation:
Sunderland.

	Peter Reid's Sunderland play at the Stadium of Light.

questions.text: This T is a London club that played at White Hart Lane until 2016.
questions.explanation:
Tottenham Hotspur.

	The Spurs are one of London's premier clubs.

questions.text: This U is an Italian club that commenced playing in Serie A in 1994-95.
questions.explanation:
Udinese.

	Founded in 1896, Udinese are one of the under-achievers of Italian Soccer.

questions.text: This V is a Portugese club that plays in white and represents the city of Portugal's first king.
questions.explanation:
Vitoria de Guimaraes.

	Afonso Henriques was the first King of Portugal, he made his capital initially at Guimaraes.

questions.text: This W is an English club who changed the name of their ground from Upton Park.
questions.explanation:
West Ham United.

	West Ham play in claret and blue and they spend their time 'blowing bubbles'.

questions.text: This X, a Spanish club is in a wine rich region.
questions.explanation:
Xerex.

	Xerex is in the Spanish second division.

questions.text: This one is doubled: this Y is an English league team. And this Z is a Spanish team (first name Real). Who are they?
questions.explanation:
York City, Zaragoza.

	York City were in the English third division in the 2001-02 and Real Zaragoza are in the Spanish Premiera Liga.
